qas.question: Who was present under the cross?
What symbol is popular in Marian Art?
Which pope claims Mary was present at Jesus' Crucifixion?
Who was responsible for the art names "His Entombment"?
What kind of medal did Raphael put in one of his paintings?
What pope did Caravaggio crate a portrait of?
What was Pope John Paul II wearing in his portrait?
Who did Caravaggio believe Mary was united to on the cross?
What famous artist worked for Pope John Paul II?

context: The presence of the <a0_0>Virgin Mary<a0_0/> under the cross[Jn. 19:26-27] has in itself been the subject of Marian art, and well known Catholic symbolism such as the <b5_0>Miraculous Medal<b5_0/> and <b6_0>Pope John Paul II<b6_0/>'s <b7_0>Coat of Arms<b7_0/> bearing a <a1_0>Marian Cross<a1_0/>. And a number of Marian devotions also involve the presence of the Virgin Mary in Calvary, e.g., <a2_0>Pope John Paul II<a2_0/> stated that "Mary was united to <b8_0>Jesus<b8_0/> on the Cross". Well known works of Christian art by masters such as <a3_0>Raphael<a3_0/> (e.g., the Mond Crucifixion), and <a4_0><b9_0>Caravaggio<b9_0/><a4_0/> (e.g., his Entombment) depict the Virgin Mary as part of the crucifixion scene.
